FROM ubuntu:22.04

# Pacotes base e depend√™ncias de GUI para VSCode/Flutter/Android
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
  curl git unzip wget libglu1-mesa openjdk-11-jdk \
  libgtk-3-0 libx11-xcb1 libxext6 libxrender1 libxtst6 libnss3 libasound2 libdbus-1-3 libglib2.0-0 ca-certificates \
  fontconfig libxrandr2 xz-utils libgbm1 && \
  rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Android SDK
ENV ANDROID_HOME=/opt/android-sdk
ENV PATH=${ANDROID_HOME}/cmdline-tools/latest/bin:${ANDROID_HOME}/platform-tools:${PATH}

# Commandline tools do Android SDK
RUN mkdir -p ${ANDROID_HOME}/cmdline-tools && \
    cd ${ANDROID_HOME} && \
    wget https://dl.google.com/android/repository/commandlinetools-linux-8512546_latest.zip -O cmdline-tools.zip && \
    unzip cmdline-tools.zip -d cmdline-tools && \
    rm cmdline-tools.zip

# Coloca o sdkmanager no PATH (layout do zip coloca em cmdline-tools/cmdline-tools/bin)
ENV PATH=${ANDROID_HOME}/cmdline-tools/cmdline-tools/bin:${PATH}

# Aceita licen√ßas do Android SDK de forma n√£o interativa
RUN yes | sdkmanager --licenses

# Flutter est√°vel
RUN git clone https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git /opt/flutter -b stable
ENV PATH="/opt/flutter/bin:/opt/flutter/bin/cache/dart-sdk/bin:${PATH}"

# Usu√°rio n√£o-root
RUN useradd -ms /bin/bash developer
USER developer
WORKDIR /home/developer

# VSCode para ARM64 (ajuste URL para armhf se for 32‚Äëbit)
# M√©todo em 2 etapas para facilitar debug e evitar problemas de pipe
RUN wget -O code-stable-x64.tar.gz "https://code.visualstudio.com/sha/download?build=stable&os=linux-x64" && \
    tar -xvf code-stable-x64.tar.gz -C /home/developer --strip-components=1 && \
    rm -r code-stable-x64.tar.gz VSCode-linux-x64 || true

# Inicia VSCode (usar DISPLAY e X11 no runtime)
CMD ["/home/developer/code", "--no-sandbox"]
</attachment>

</attachments>

FROM ubuntu:22.04

# Evita prompts interativos durante instala√ß√£o
ENV DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive

# Pacotes essenciais para Flutter/Android (removidas depend√™ncias de GUI do VSCode)
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
  curl git unzip wget xz-utils \
  openjdk-11-jdk \
  libglu1-mesa \
  clang cmake ninja-build pkg-config libgtk-3-dev \
  ca-certificates \
  && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Usu√°rio n√£o-root (criar antes de instalar SDKs)
RUN useradd -ms /bin/bash developer && \
    mkdir -p /home/developer/.android && \
    chown -R developer:developer /home/developer

USER developer
WORKDIR /home/developer

# Vari√°veis de ambiente para SDKs (apontando para volumes)
ENV FLUTTER_HOME=/home/developer/flutter-sdk
ENV ANDROID_HOME=/home/developer/android-sdk
ENV PUB_CACHE=/home/developer/.pub-cache
ENV GRADLE_USER_HOME=/home/developer/.gradle

# Adiciona ao PATH
ENV PATH="${FLUTTER_HOME}/bin:${FLUTTER_HOME}/bin/cache/dart-sdk/bin:${ANDROID_HOME}/cmdline-tools/latest/bin:${ANDROID_HOME}/platform-tools:${ANDROID_HOME}/build-tools/34.0.0:${PATH}"

# Script de inicializa√ß√£o para verificar/instalar SDKs
COPY --chown=developer:developer init-sdk.sh /home/developer/init-sdk.sh
RUN chmod +x /home/developer/init-sdk.sh

# Mant√©m container rodando e permite comandos interativos
CMD ["/bin/bash", "/home/developer/init-sdk.sh"]

# Pacotes base e depend√™ncias de GUI para VSCode/Flutter/Android

RUN mkdir -p ${ANDROID_HOME}/cmdline-tools && \
    cd ${ANDROID_HOME} && \
    wget https://dl.google.com/android/repository/commandlinetools-linux-8512546_latest.zip -O cmdline-tools.zip && \
    unzip cmdline-tools.zip -d cmdline-tools && \

# Aceita licen√ßas do Android SDK de forma n√£o interativa
RUN yes | sdkmanager --licenses

# Flutter est√°vel
RUN git clone https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git /opt/flutter -b stable
ENV PATH="/opt/flutter/bin:/opt/flutter/bin/cache/dart-sdk/bin:${PATH}"

# Usu√°rio n√£o-root
RUN useradd -ms /bin/bash developer
USER developer
WORKDIR /home/developer

# VSCode para ARM64 (ajuste URL para armhf se for 32‚Äëbit)
# M√©todo em 2 etapas para facilitar debug e evitar problemas de pipe
RUN wget -O code-stable-x64.tar.gz "https://code.visualstudio.com/sha/download?build=stable&os=linux-x64" && \

# Evita prompts interativos durante instala√ß√£o

    mkdir -p /home/developer/.android && \
    chown -R developer:developer /home/developer

USER developer

# Vari√°veis de ambiente para SDKs (apontando para volumes)
ENV FLUTTER_HOME=/home/developer/flutter-sdk
ENV ANDROID_HOME=/home/developer/android-sdk
ENV PUB_CACHE=/home/developer/.pub-cache
ENV GRADLE_USER_HOME=/home/developer/.gradle

# Adiciona ao PATH
ENV PATH="${FLUTTER_HOME}/bin:${FLUTTER_HOME}/bin/cache/dart-sdk/bin:${ANDROID_HOME}/cmdline-tools/latest/bin:${ANDROID_HOME}/platform-tools:${ANDROID_HOME}/build-tools/34.0.0:${PATH}"

# Script de inicializa√ß√£o para verificar/instalar SDKs
COPY --chown=developer:developer init-sdk.sh /home/developer/init-sdk.sh
RUN chmod +x /home/developer/init-sdk.sh

# Mant√©m container rodando e permite comandos interativos
CMD ["/bin/bash", "/home/developer/init-sdk.sh"]"}

{"filePath": "/home/mamaral-/Documents/42Advanced/init-sdk.sh", "content": "#!/bin/bash
set -e

echo "üöÄ Inicializando ambiente Flutter/Android..."

# Cores para output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Verifica e instala Flutter SDK
if [ ! -d "$FLUTTER_HOME/bin" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Flutter SDK n√£o encontrado. Instalando...${NC}"
    git clone https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git "$FLUTTER_HOME" -b stable --depth 1
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK instalado${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK j√° existe${NC}"
fi

# Verifica e instala Android SDK
if [ ! -d "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Android SDK n√£o encontrado. Instalando...${NC}"
    mkdir -p "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools"
    cd "$ANDROID_HOME"
    wget -q https://dl.google.com/android/repository/commandlinetools-linux-8512546_latest.zip -O cmdline-tools.zip
    unzip -q cmdline-tools.zip -d cmdline-tools
    mv cmdline-tools/cmdline-tools cmdline-tools/latest
    rm cmdline-tools.zip
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Android SDK cmdline-tools instalado${NC}"
    
    # Instala componentes essenciais do Android
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Instalando componentes Android...${NC}"
    yes | sdkmanager --licenses > /dev/null 2>&1 || true
    sdkmanager "platform-tools" "platforms;android-34" "build-tools;34.0.0" "emulator" "system-images;android-34;google_apis;x86_64"
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Componentes Android instalados${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Android SDK j√° existe${NC}"
fi

# Configura Flutter
echo -e "${YELLOW}‚öôÔ∏è  Configurando Flutter...${NC}"
flutter config --no-analytics
flutter config --android-sdk "$ANDROID_HOME"
flutter doctor -v

echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Ambiente pronto!${NC}"
echo ""
echo "üì± Use 'docker exec -it flutter-dev-container flutter <comando>'"
echo "üîß Ou entre no container: 'docker exec -it flutter-dev-container bash'"
echo ""

# Mant√©m container rodando
exec tail -f /dev/null
"}

{"filePath": "/home/mamaral-/Documents/42Advanced/flutter-helper.sh", "content": "#!/bin/bash
# Script auxiliar para facilitar comandos Flutter no container

CONTAINER_NAME="flutter-dev-container"

# Verifica se container est√° rodando
if ! docker ps | grep -q "$CONTAINER_NAME"; then
    echo "‚ùå Container n√£o est√° rodando. Execute: docker-compose up -d"
    exit 1
fi

# Se nenhum argumento, mostra ajuda
if [ $# -eq 0 ]; then
    echo "üéØ Flutter Helper - Comandos dispon√≠veis:"
    echo ""
    echo "  ./flutter-helper.sh <comando flutter>  - Executa comando Flutter"
    echo "  ./flutter-helper.sh shell              - Abre shell no container"
    echo "  ./flutter-helper.sh doctor             - Executa flutter doctor"
    echo ""
    echo "Exemplos:"
    echo "  ./flutter-helper.sh create meu_app"
    echo "  ./flutter-helper.sh pub get"
    echo "  ./flutter-helper.sh run"
    exit 0
fi

# Comando especial para abrir shell
if [ "$1" = "shell" ]; then
    docker exec -it "$CONTAINER_NAME" bash
    exit 0
fi

# Executa comando Flutter
docker exec -it "$CONTAINER_NAME" flutter "$@"
"}

{"content": "# Flutter Docker Environment

Ambiente containerizado para desenvolvimento Flutter com Android SDK, otimizado para uso com NFS.

## üìã Estrutura

```
/home/mamaral-/sgoinfre/          # Volumes NFS (persist√™ncia)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ flutter-sdk/                   # Flutter SDK
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ android-sdk/                   # Android SDK  
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ pub-cache/                     # Packages Dart/Flutter
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ gradle-cache/                  # Cache Gradle
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ android-config/                # Configura√ß√µes Android

/home/mamaral-/Documents/42Advanced/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ pastaCompartilhada/            # Seus projetos (local + container)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Dockerfile
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ docker-compose.yaml
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ init-sdk.sh                    # Script de inicializa√ß√£o
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ flutter-helper.sh              # Helper para comandos
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md
```

## üöÄ Uso

### 1. Primeira execu√ß√£o (instala SDKs)
```bash
docker-compose up -d
```

Aguarde a instala√ß√£o dos SDKs (pode levar alguns minutos na primeira vez).

### 2. Verificar instala√ß√£o
```bash
docker logs flutter-dev-container
```

### 3. Usar Flutter

#### Op√ß√£o A: Com o helper script (recomendado)
```bash
chmod +x flutter-helper.sh

# Verificar ambiente
./flutter-helper.sh doctor

# Criar novo projeto
./flutter-helper.sh create meu_app

# Instalar depend√™ncias
cd pastaCompartilhada/meu_app
../../flutter-helper.sh pub get

# Rodar app
./flutter-helper.sh run

# Abrir shell no container
./flutter-helper.sh shell
```

#### Op√ß√£o B: Comandos diretos
```bash
# Executar comando Flutter
docker exec -it flutter-dev-container flutter doctor

# Entrar no container
docker exec -it flutter-dev-container bash
```

## üí° VSCode Integration

1. Abra o VSCode **no seu host** (n√£o no container)
2. Instale a extens√£o "Flutter"
3. Configure o Flutter SDK path para usar o container:

   **M√©todo 1: Via settings.json**
   ```json
   {
     "dart.flutterSdkPath": "/home/mamaral-/sgoinfre/flutter-sdk"
   }
   ```

   **M√©todo 2: Remote - Containers**
   - Instale extens√£o "Dev Containers"
   - Use "Attach to Running Container"
   - Selecione `flutter-dev-container`

## üîß Comandos √∫teis

```bash
# Parar container
docker-compose down

# Rebuild (ap√≥s mudan√ßas no Dockerfile)
docker-compose up -d --build

# Ver logs
docker logs -f flutter-dev-container

# Limpar tudo (CUIDADO: apaga volumes NFS)
docker-compose down -v
rm -rf /home/mamaral-/sgoinfre/flutter-sdk
rm -rf /home/mamaral-/sgoinfre/android-sdk
```

## üì¶ O que est√° inclu√≠do

- ‚úÖ Flutter SDK (stable channel)
- ‚úÖ Android SDK (API 34)
- ‚úÖ Build tools 34.0.0
- ‚úÖ Platform tools
- ‚úÖ Emulator
- ‚úÖ Java 11 (OpenJDK)
- ‚úÖ Dart SDK (inclu√≠do no Flutter)

## üéØ Vantagens desta abordagem

1. **Espa√ßo local preservado**: SDKs grandes ficam no NFS
2. **Persist√™ncia**: Reinstalar container n√£o perde SDKs
3. **Performance**: Cache compartilhado entre rebuilds
4. **Flexibilidade**: VSCode no host com todas funcionalidades
5. **Sem sudo**: Tudo roda no container

## üêõ Troubleshooting

### Container n√£o inicia
```bash
docker-compose logs
```

### Flutter n√£o encontrado
```bash
docker exec -it flutter-dev-container bash
echo $PATH
which flutter
```

### Limpar cache
```bash
docker exec -it flutter-dev-container flutter clean
docker exec -it flutter-dev-container flutter pub cache repair
```

### Permiss√µes NFS
Certifique-se que `/home/mamaral-/sgoinfre` √© grav√°vel:
```bash
touch /home/mamaral-/sgoinfre/test.txt && rm /home/mamaral-/sgoinfre/test.txt
```

#!/bin/bash
set -e

echo "üöÄ Inicializando ambiente Flutter/Android..."

# Cores para output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Verifica e instala Flutter SDK
if [ ! -f "$FLUTTER_HOME/bin/flutter" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Flutter SDK n√£o encontrado. Instalando...${NC}"
    git clone https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git "$FLUTTER_HOME" -b stable --depth 1
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK instalado${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK j√° existe${NC}"
fi

# Verifica e instala Android SDK
if [ ! -f "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/bin/sdkmanager" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Android SDK n√£o encontrado. Instalando...${NC}"
    mkdir -p "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools"
    cd "$ANDROID_HOME"
    wget -q https://dl.google.com/android/repository/commandlinetools-linux-8512546_latest.zip -O cmdline-tools.zip
    unzip -q cmdline-tools.zip -d cmdline-tools
    mv cmdline-tools/cmdline-tools cmdline-tools/latest
    rm cmdline-tools.zip
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Android SDK cmdline-tools instalado${NC}"
    
    # Instala componentes essenciais do Android
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Instalando componentes Android...${NC}"
    yes | sdkmanager --licenses > /dev/null 2>&1 || true
    sdkmanager "platform-tools" "platforms;android-34" "build-tools;34.0.0"
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Componentes Android instalados${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Android SDK j√° existe${NC}"
fi

# Configura Flutter
echo -e "${YELLOW}‚öôÔ∏è  Configurando Flutter...${NC}"
flutter config --no-analytics
flutter config --android-sdk "$ANDROID_HOME"
flutter doctor -v

echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Ambiente pronto!${NC}"
echo ""
echo "üì± Use 'docker exec -it flutter-dev-container flutter <comando>'"
echo "üîß Ou entre no container: 'docker exec -it flutter-dev-container bash'"
echo ""

# Mant√©m container rodando
exec tail -f /dev/null

else

fi

# Verifica Android SDK
if [ ! -f "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/bin/sdkmanager" ]; then

    echo -e "${YELLOW}Execute no HOST: ./setup-volumes.sh${NC}"

else

fi

# Configura Flutter

toolCalls.arguments:
{"filePath": "/home/mamaral-/Documents/42Advanced/setup-volumes.sh", "content": "#!/bin/bash
set -e

echo "üîß Configurando volumes NFS..."

# Diret√≥rios base
BASE_DIR="/home/mamaral-/sgoinfre"
FLUTTER_DIR="$BASE_DIR/flutter-sdk"
ANDROID_DIR="$BASE_DIR/android-sdk"

# Instala Flutter SDK se n√£o existir
if [ ! -f "$FLUTTER_DIR/bin/flutter" ]; then
    echo "üì¶ Instalando Flutter SDK..."
    rm -rf "$FLUTTER_DIR"
    git clone https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git "$FLUTTER_DIR" -b stable --depth 1
    echo "‚úì Flutter SDK instalado"
else
    echo "‚úì Flutter SDK j√° existe"
fi

# Instala Android SDK se n√£o existir
if [ ! -f "$ANDROID_DIR/cmdline-tools/latest/bin/sdkmanager" ]; then
    echo "üì¶ Instalando Android SDK..."
    rm -rf "$ANDROID_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$ANDROID_DIR/cmdline-tools"
    cd "$ANDROID_DIR"
    wget -q https://dl.google.com/android/repository/commandlinetools-linux-8512546_latest.zip -O cmdline-tools.zip
    unzip -q cmdline-tools.zip -d cmdline-tools
    mv cmdline-tools/cmdline-tools cmdline-tools/latest
    rm cmdline-tools.zip
    echo "‚úì Android cmdline-tools instalado"
    
    echo "üì¶ Instalando componentes Android (pode demorar)..."
    # Precisa rodar no container pois precisa do Java
    docker run --rm \
        -v "$ANDROID_DIR:/opt/android-sdk" \
        -e ANDROID_HOME=/opt/android-sdk \
        -e PATH=/opt/android-sdk/cmdline-tools/latest/bin:/opt/android-sdk/platform-tools:\$PATH \
        42advanced-flutter-dev \
        bash -c "yes | sdkmanager --licenses && sdkmanager 'platform-tools' 'platforms;android-34' 'build-tools;34.0.0'"
    echo "‚úì Componentes Android instalados"
else
    echo "‚úì Android SDK j√° existe"
fi

# Cria outros diret√≥rios
mkdir -p "$BASE_DIR/pub-cache"
mkdir -p "$BASE_DIR/gradle-cache"
mkdir -p "$BASE_DIR/android-config"

echo ""
echo "‚úÖ Volumes configurados com sucesso!"
echo "Execute: docker-compose up -d"
"}

<attachments>
<attachment id="setup-volumes.sh" filePath="/home/mamaral-/Documents/42Advanced/setup-volumes.sh">
#!/bin/zsh
set -e

echo "üîß Configurando volumes NFS..."

# Diret√≥rios base
BASE_DIR="/home/mamaral-/sgoinfre"
FLUTTER_DIR="$BASE_DIR/flutter-sdk"
ANDROID_DIR="$BASE_DIR/android-sdk"

# Instala Flutter SDK se n√£o existir
if [ ! -f "$FLUTTER_DIR/bin/flutter" ]; then
    echo "üì¶ Instalando Flutter SDK..."
    rm -rf "$FLUTTER_DIR"
    git clone https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git "$FLUTTER_DIR" -b stable --depth 1
    echo "‚úì Flutter SDK instalado"
else
    echo "‚úì Flutter SDK j√° existe"
fi

# Instala Android SDK se n√£o existir
if [ ! -f "$ANDROID_DIR/cmdline-tools/latest/bin/sdkmanager" ]; then
    echo "üì¶ Instalando Android SDK..."
    rm -rf "$ANDROID_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$ANDROID_DIR/cmdline-tools"
    cd "$ANDROID_DIR"
    wget -q https://dl.google.com/android/repository/commandlinetools-linux-8512546_latest.zip -O cmdline-tools.zip
    unzip -q cmdline-tools.zip -d cmdline-tools
    mv cmdline-tools/cmdline-tools cmdline-tools/latest
    rm cmdline-tools.zip
    echo "‚úì Android cmdline-tools instalado"
    
    echo "üì¶ Instalando componentes Android (pode demorar)..."
    # Precisa rodar no container pois precisa do Java
    docker run --rm \
        -v "$ANDROID_DIR:/opt/android-sdk" \
        -e ANDROID_HOME=/opt/android-sdk \
        -e PATH=/opt/android-sdk/cmdline-tools/latest/bin:/opt/android-sdk/platform-tools:\$PATH \
        42advanced-flutter-dev \
        zsh -c "yes | sdkmanager --licenses && sdkmanager 'platform-tools' 'platforms;android-34' 'build-tools;34.0.0'"
    echo "‚úì Componentes Android instalados"
else
    echo "‚úì Android SDK j√° existe"
fi

# Cria outros diret√≥rios
mkdir -p "$BASE_DIR/pub-cache"
mkdir -p "$BASE_DIR/gradle-cache"
mkdir -p "$BASE_DIR/android-config"

echo ""
echo "‚úÖ Volumes configurados com sucesso!"
echo "Execute: docker-compose up -d"
</attachment>

#!/bin/bash
set -e

echo "üöÄ Instalando Flutter e Android SDK localmente (sem sudo/docker)"
echo ""

# Diret√≥rios NFS
SGOINFRE="/home/mamaral-/sgoinfre"
FLUTTER_NFS="$SGOINFRE/flutter-sdk"
ANDROID_NFS="$SGOINFRE/android-sdk"
JAVA_NFS="$SGOINFRE/openjdk-11"

# Diret√≥rios locais (symlinks)
LOCAL_HOME="$HOME/.local"
FLUTTER_DIR="$LOCAL_HOME/flutter-sdk"
ANDROID_DIR="$LOCAL_HOME/android-sdk"
JAVA_DIR="$LOCAL_HOME/openjdk-11"

    wget -q https://download.java.net/java/GA/jdk11/9/GPL/openjdk-11.0.2_linux-x64_bin.tar.gz
    tar -xzf openjdk-11.0.2_linux-x64_bin.tar.gz
    mv jdk-11.0.2 openjdk-11
    rm openjdk-11.0.2_linux-x64_bin.tar.gz

response.value:
**Planning debug steps**

I need to keep working since the user mentioned the problem still exists. We switched to a local install, but the error "Waiting for another flutter command to release the startup lock..." persists, even with symlinks. So, I‚Äôll create a todo list to track my progress. 

First, I‚Äôll verify the symlink structure and environment variables. Then, I‚Äôll check if the flutter executable is set up correctly and look for any lockfiles in the specified directories. Let's get started!

**Analyzing Flutter's locking issue**

I‚Äôm looking into why the Flutter tool might be stuck with multiple instances on NFS. It seems that when first run, Flutter spawns itself to update, which may explain the two instances. The main issue appears to be the "startup lock," potentially linked to the 'flutter/flutter_upgrade' file. 

Flutter uses a file called 'bin/cache/flutter_version_check' for locking. The actual messages come from the script in 'bin/flutter', and it can be complicated by NFS issues. To resolve this, I think keeping the Flutter tool directory local while using NFS for cache could be the way to go.

**Exploring Flutter SDK storage options**

The Flutter SDK is quite large, around 1.5GB, and the initial run actually downloads the Dart SDK to the bin/cache within the Flutter directory. If that directory is symlinked to NFS, we might still face lock issues. One solution could be to place the Flutter SDK locally while keeping just the pub and gradle caches on NFS. 

The user mentioned having less than 5GB of local storage, which could work with Flutter, but they prefer using NFS for larger files. I‚Äôm considering moving the 'bin/cache' to a local path and symlinking it to reduce locking issues on NFS.

**Setting up local cache for Flutter**

When Flutter runs for the first time, the 'bin/cache' directory stores the Dart SDK and engine artifacts, which can take up about 1-2GB. Since this might lead to locking issues if it stays on NFS, moving the cache to a local path under /.cache/flutter-cache could be ideal. 

To implement this, I‚Äôll create the local path, then replace the symlink for 'flutter-sdk/bin/cache' to point to the new local directory. I also need to ensure the install script updates this symlink and possibly modify the PATH variable to include the Dart SDK from the new location. If I have write access, replacing should be fine.

**Implementing Flutter cache and process management**

First, I need to create a local cache and set up a symlink for Flutter. I want to ensure that the Flutter command runs only once and discourage version checks that might spawn multiple processes. 

Setting the environment variable `FLUTTER_SKIP_UPDATE_CHECK=true` could help, along with options like `FLUTTER_SUPPRESS_ANALYTICS=1`. If another command is causing multiple instances, it seems that can happen with commands like `flutter --version` or due to the bash wrapper. 

The main fix is to implement local caching by modifying the install script. I need to set up the local cache, ensuring it‚Äôs created and linked properly, while also addressing existing processes. After making these adjustments, I‚Äôll run the script and test it out with `flutter --version`. Let's also track this with the todo list tool to keep things organized!

#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail

echo "üöÄ Instalando Flutter e Android SDK localmente (sem sudo/docker)"
echo ""

# Montagem NFS (somente dados/caches)
SGOINFRE="/home/mamaral-/sgoinfre"
ANDROID_NFS="$SGOINFRE/android-sdk"   # Armazenar√° 'platforms' e artefatos pesados (somente leitura/grav.)
PUB_CACHE_NFS="$SGOINFRE/pub-cache"
GRADLE_CACHE_NFS="$SGOINFRE/gradle-cache"

# Diret√≥rios locais (execut√°veis e ferramentas)
LOCAL_HOME="$HOME/.local"
JAVA_DIR="$LOCAL_HOME/openjdk-11"
FLUTTER_DIR="$LOCAL_HOME/flutter-sdk"   # Flutter totalmente local (execut√°veis + Dart SDK)
ANDROID_DIR="$LOCAL_HOME/android-sdk"   # cmdline-tools, platform-tools e build-tools locais

mkdir -p "$LOCAL_HOME"
mkdir -p "$ANDROID_DIR"
mkdir -p "$ANDROID_NFS"
mkdir -p "$PUB_CACHE_NFS" "$GRADLE_CACHE_NFS"

# Cores
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m'

echo -e "${BLUE}üìÇ Usando diret√≥rio: $SGOINFRE${NC}"
echo ""

# 1. Java local (execut√°vel precisa estar fora do NFS/noexec)
if [ ! -d "$JAVA_DIR" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Baixando OpenJDK 11 (local)...${NC}"
    cd "$LOCAL_HOME"
    wget -q https://download.java.net/java/GA/jdk11/9/GPL/openjdk-11.0.2_linux-x64_bin.tar.gz
    tar -xzf openjdk-11.0.2_linux-x64_bin.tar.gz
    mv jdk-11.0.2 "$(basename "$JAVA_DIR")"
    rm openjdk-11.0.2_linux-x64_bin.tar.gz
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì OpenJDK instalado em $JAVA_DIR${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì OpenJDK j√° existe em $JAVA_DIR${NC}"
fi

export JAVA_HOME="$JAVA_DIR"
export PATH="$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH"

# 2. Flutter local (para evitar lock/exec em NFS)
if [ ! -f "$FLUTTER_DIR/bin/flutter" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Clonando Flutter SDK (local)...${NC}"
    git clone https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git "$FLUTTER_DIR" -b stable --depth 1
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK instalado em $FLUTTER_DIR${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK j√° existe em $FLUTTER_DIR${NC}"
fi

export PATH="$FLUTTER_DIR/bin:$PATH"

# 3. Android SDK - cmdline-tools LOCAL, plataformas no NFS
# 3.1 cmdline-tools (LOCAL)
if [ ! -f "$ANDROID_DIR/cmdline-tools/latest/bin/sdkmanager" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Baixando Android cmdline-tools (local)...${NC}"
    mkdir -p "$ANDROID_DIR/cmdline-tools"
    cd "$ANDROID_DIR"
    wget -q https://dl.google.com/android/repository/commandlinetools-linux-8512546_latest.zip -O cmdline-tools.zip
    unzip -q cmdline-tools.zip -d cmdline-tools
    mv cmdline-tools/cmdline-tools cmdline-tools/latest
    rm cmdline-tools.zip
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì cmdline-tools instalado em $ANDROID_DIR${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì cmdline-tools j√° existe em $ANDROID_DIR${NC}"
fi

export ANDROID_HOME="$ANDROID_DIR"
export ANDROID_SDK_ROOT="$ANDROID_HOME"
export PATH="$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/bin:$ANDROID_HOME/platform-tools:$PATH"

# 3.2 Instalar execut√°veis (LOCAL): platform-tools e build-tools
if [ ! -d "$ANDROID_HOME/platform-tools" ] || [ ! -d "$ANDROID_HOME/build-tools/34.0.0" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Instalando execut√°veis Android locais...${NC}"
    yes | sdkmanager --licenses >/dev/null 2>&1 || true
    sdkmanager "platform-tools" "build-tools;34.0.0"
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì platform-tools e build-tools instalados localmente${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Execut√°veis Android j√° instalados localmente${NC}"
fi

# 3.3 Instalar plataformas (NFS) e ligar no local
if [ ! -d "$ANDROID_NFS/platforms/android-34" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Instalando plataformas Android no NFS...${NC}"
    ANDROID_SDK_ROOT="$ANDROID_NFS" ANDROID_HOME="$ANDROID_NFS" sdkmanager "platforms;android-34"
    # Aceitar licen√ßas no NFS tamb√©m
    ANDROID_SDK_ROOT="$ANDROID_NFS" ANDROID_HOME="$ANDROID_NFS" bash -lc 'yes | sdkmanager --licenses >/dev/null 2>&1 || true'
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì platforms;android-34 instalado no NFS${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì platforms;android-34 j√° existe no NFS${NC}"
fi

# Linkar plataformas do NFS no SDK local
ln -sfn "$ANDROID_NFS/platforms" "$ANDROID_HOME/platforms"
echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Vinculado platforms -> $ANDROID_NFS/platforms${NC}"

# (Passo 4 consolidado acima)

# 4. Configurar caches (somente dados) no NFS com symlinks locais
echo -e "${YELLOW}üîó Configurando caches...${NC}"
mkdir -p "$PUB_CACHE_NFS" "$GRADLE_CACHE_NFS" "$SGOINFRE/android-config"
rm -rf "$HOME/.pub-cache" "$HOME/.gradle" "$HOME/.android" 2>/dev/null || true
ln -sfn "$PUB_CACHE_NFS" "$HOME/.pub-cache"
ln -sfn "$GRADLE_CACHE_NFS" "$HOME/.gradle"
ln -sfn "$SGOINFRE/android-config" "$HOME/.android"
echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Caches configurados${NC}"

# 5. Configurar Flutter
echo -e "${YELLOW}‚öôÔ∏è  Configurando Flutter...${NC}"
flutter config --no-analytics
flutter config --android-sdk "$ANDROID_HOME"

# 7. Verificar instala√ß√£o
echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Instala√ß√£o conclu√≠da!${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ${NC}"
echo ""
echo "üìù Adicione ao seu ~/.zshrc:"
echo ""
echo -e "${YELLOW}export JAVA_HOME=\"$JAVA_DIR\"${NC}"
echo -e "${YELLOW}export FLUTTER_HOME=\"$FLUTTER_DIR\"${NC}"
echo -e "${YELLOW}export ANDROID_HOME=\"$ANDROID_DIR\"${NC}"
echo -e "${YELLOW}export ANDROID_SDK_ROOT=\"$ANDROID_DIR\"${NC}"
echo -e "${YELLOW}export PUB_CACHE=\"$PUB_CACHE_NFS\"${NC}"
echo -e "${YELLOW}export GRADLE_USER_HOME=\"$GRADLE_CACHE_NFS\"${NC}"
echo -e "${YELLOW}export PATH=\"\$JAVA_HOME/bin:\$FLUTTER_HOME/bin:\$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/bin:\$ANDROID_HOME/platform-tools:\$PATH\"${NC}"
echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}Depois execute: source ~/.zshrc${NC}"
echo ""
echo "üß™ Teste com: flutter doctor"
echo ""

PUB_CACHE_NFS="$SGOINFRE/pub-cache"
GRADLE_CACHE_NFS="$SGOINFRE/gradle-cache"

# Diret√≥rios locais (execut√°veis e ferramentas)
LOCAL_HOME="$HOME/.local"
JAVA_DIR="$LOCAL_HOME/openjdk-11"
FLUTTER_DIR="$LOCAL_HOME/flutter-sdk"   # Flutter totalmente local (execut√°veis + Dart SDK)

mkdir -p "$LOCAL_HOME"
mkdir -p "$ANDROID_DIR"
mkdir -p "$ANDROID_NFS"
mkdir -p "$PUB_CACHE_NFS" "$GRADLE_CACHE_NFS"

# Cores
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m'

echo -e "${BLUE}üìÇ Usando diret√≥rio: $SGOINFRE${NC}"
echo ""

# 1. Java local (execut√°vel precisa estar fora do NFS/noexec)
if [ ! -d "$JAVA_DIR" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Baixando OpenJDK 11 (local)...${NC}"
    cd "$LOCAL_HOME"
    wget -q https://download.java.net/java/GA/jdk11/9/GPL/openjdk-11.0.2_linux-x64_bin.tar.gz
    tar -xzf openjdk-11.0.2_linux-x64_bin.tar.gz

    rm openjdk-11.0.2_linux-x64_bin.tar.gz

else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì OpenJDK j√° existe em $JAVA_DIR${NC}"
fi

export JAVA_HOME="$JAVA_DIR"
export PATH="$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH"

# 2. Flutter local (para evitar lock/exec em NFS)
if [ ! -f "$FLUTTER_DIR/bin/flutter" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Clonando Flutter SDK (local)...${NC}"
    git clone https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git "$FLUTTER_DIR" -b stable --depth 1
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK instalado em $FLUTTER_DIR${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK j√° existe em $FLUTTER_DIR${NC}"
fi

export PATH="$FLUTTER_DIR/bin:$PATH"

# 3. Android SDK - cmdline-tools LOCAL, plataformas no NFS
# 3.1 cmdline-tools (LOCAL)
if [ ! -f "$ANDROID_DIR/cmdline-tools/latest/bin/sdkmanager" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Baixando Android cmdline-tools (local)...${NC}"
    mkdir -p "$ANDROID_DIR/cmdline-tools"

else

fi

export ANDROID_HOME="$ANDROID_DIR"
export ANDROID_SDK_ROOT="$ANDROID_HOME"
export PATH="$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/bin:$ANDROID_HOME/platform-tools:$PATH"

# 3.2 Instalar execut√°veis (LOCAL): platform-tools e build-tools
if [ ! -d "$ANDROID_HOME/platform-tools" ] || [ ! -d "$ANDROID_HOME/build-tools/34.0.0" ]; then

else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Execut√°veis Android j√° instalados localmente${NC}"
fi

# 3.3 Instalar plataformas (NFS) e ligar no local
if [ ! -d "$ANDROID_NFS/platforms/android-34" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Instalando plataformas Android no NFS...${NC}"
    ANDROID_SDK_ROOT="$ANDROID_NFS" ANDROID_HOME="$ANDROID_NFS" sdkmanager "platforms;android-34"

echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Vinculado platforms -> $ANDROID_NFS/platforms${NC}"

# (Passo 4 consolidado acima)

echo -e "${YELLOW}üîó Configurando caches...${NC}"
mkdir -p "$PUB_CACHE_NFS" "$GRADLE_CACHE_NFS" "$SGOINFRE/android-config"

ln -sfn "$PUB_CACHE_NFS" "$HOME/.pub-cache"
ln -sfn "$GRADLE_CACHE_NFS" "$HOME/.gradle"
ln -sfn "$SGOINFRE/android-config" "$HOME/.android"
echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Caches configurados${NC}"

# 5. Configurar Flutter
echo -e "${YELLOW}‚öôÔ∏è  Configurando Flutter...${NC}"
# Evitar conflitos de lock de inicializa√ß√£o

pkill -f "${FLUTTER_DIR}/bin/cache/dart-sdk/bin/dart" 2>/dev/null || true
LOCKFILE="${FLUTTER_DIR}/bin/cache/lockfile"
[ -f "$LOCKFILE" ] && rm -f "$LOCKFILE" || true

# Primeira inicializa√ß√£o controlada
export FLUTTER_DISABLE_ANALYTICS=true
flutter --version >/dev/null 2>&1 || true

# Aplicar configura√ß√µes
flutter config --no-analytics
flutter config --android-sdk "$ANDROID_HOME"

echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ${NC}"

echo -e "${BLUE}‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ${NC}"

I‚Äôm realizing that if the sgoinfre mount is set to noexec, it prevents execution of any binaries, explaining why running Dart from there fails and causes issues. To resolve this, I plan to keep all executables on the local filesystem while storing their data directories in sgoinfre. However, the build-tools and platform-tools include executables that need to be executed too. If there's a noexec restriction, those won't run. I‚Äôm coming up with a plan to manage storage for the user‚Äôs setup. I want to keep all executable binaries on the local disk. However, the build-tools and platforms might exceed the 5GB limit if handled improperly, especially since executables can‚Äôt run from an NFS with a noexec restriction. The user specifically wants Android support, so that complicates things.**Developing a comprehensive installation plan**

I'm piecing together a robust plan for software installation, considering NFS mount restrictions. Since running executables from NFS when it's noexec doesn't work, I‚Äôll focus on placing essential SDKs locally while keeping data on NFS wherever possible. This includes installing both Flutter and OpenJDK locally, managing Android command-line tools and build-tools to remain local, and symlinking large data files. The JDK, Android tools, and Flutter SDK total nearly 2.3GB, which comfortably fits the user‚Äôs 5GB limit. # 1. Instalar Flutter SDK
if [ ! -f "$FLUTTER_HOME/bin/flutter" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Baixando Flutter SDK...${NC}"
    TMP_DIR="/tmp/flutter-install"
    rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$TMP_DIR"
    cd "$TMP_DIR"
    git clone https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git flutter-sdk -b stable --depth 1
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Movendo para $FLUTTER_HOME...${NC}"
    sudo rm -rf "$FLUTTER_HOME"/* "$FLUTTER_HOME"/.* 2>/dev/null || true
    sudo mv flutter-sdk/* flutter-sdk/.* "$FLUTTER_HOME"/ 2>/dev/null || true
    sudo chown -R developer:developer "$FLUTTER_HOME"
    cd ~
    rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK instalado${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK j√° existe${NC}"
fi

    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Android cmdline-tools instalado${NC}"
else

edits.text:
# 1. Instalar Flutter SDK
if [ ! -f "$FLUTTER_HOME/bin/flutter" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Baixando Flutter SDK...${NC}"
    TMP_DIR="/tmp/flutter-install"
    rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$TMP_DIR"
    cd "$TMP_DIR"
    git clone https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git flutter-sdk -b stable --depth 1
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Copiando para $FLUTTER_HOME...${NC}"
    # Criar diret√≥rio tempor√°rio em /opt e depois renomear
    sudo rm -rf /opt/flutter-tmp
    sudo mkdir -p /opt/flutter-tmp
    sudo cp -r flutter-sdk/. /opt/flutter-tmp/
    
    # Remover conte√∫do antigo e substituir
    sudo find "$FLUTTER_HOME" -mindepth 1 -delete 2>/dev/null || true
    sudo cp -r /opt/flutter-tmp/. "$FLUTTER_HOME"/
    sudo rm -rf /opt/flutter-tmp
    
    cd ~
    rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK instalado${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK j√° existe${NC}"
fi

<summary>
1. Conversation Overview:
- Primary Objectives: 
  - "contenerizar o VSCode com Flutter (e todas as dependencias para Android) instalado"
  - Use NFS storage (/home/mamaral-/sgoinfre) for SDKs due to <5GB local storage limit
  - Share development files via pastaCompartilhada between host and container
  - No sudo access on host, all installation must happen in container
  
- Session Context: Started with attempting Docker + VSCode in container approach, discovered NFS noexec prevented binary execution. Attempted local installation with symlinks, but hit same noexec issue. Returned to Docker as solution since containers can execute binaries from NFS-mounted volumes. Currently debugging installation script to properly copy Flutter/Android SDKs from /tmp to NFS volumes without triggering ownership errors.

- User Intent Evolution: Initial request was containerized VSCode + Flutter. Evolved to understanding core issue was NFS noexec restriction. Final approach: Docker container with SDKs on NFS (where they CAN execute), VSCode running on host connecting to container.

2. Technical Foundation:
- Docker/docker-compose: Container orchestration for Flutter development environment
- Ubuntu 22.04: Base container image
- OpenJDK 11: Required for Android SDK tools (sdkmanager, platform-tools)
- Flutter SDK (stable): ~1.5GB, installed to /opt/flutter (NFS-backed volume)
- Android SDK: cmdline-tools + platform-tools + build-tools + platforms;android-34, installed to /opt/android-sdk
- NFS constraints: /home/mamaral-/sgoinfre mounted with noexec, no chown support, no ownership preservation

3. Codebase Status:
- Dockerfile:
  - Purpose: Define Flutter development container image
  - Current State: Installs Ubuntu 22.04, dependencies (git, wget, curl, openjdk-11, sudo, build tools), creates developer user with NOPASSWD sudo
  - Key Segments: RUN apt-get install with sudo package; RUN useradd -m developer with sudoers entry; RUN mkdir /opt directories with developer ownership
  - Dependencies: Base for entire containerized environment
  
- docker-compose.yaml:
  - Purpose: Orchestrate container with volume mappings
  - Current State: Maps 5 NFS volumes (/opt/flutter, /opt/android-sdk, /opt/pub-cache, /opt/gradle-cache, /opt/android-config) and 1 local volume (pastaCompartilhada to /home/developer/project)
  - Key Segments: Volume definitions using /home/mamaral-/sgoinfre paths; command points to setup-sdks.sh
  - Dependencies: Requires NFS mount availability, local pastaCompartilhada directory

- setup-sdks.sh:
  - Purpose: Initialize Flutter and Android SDK installations in container on first run
  - Current State: Modified to use /tmp as staging area, cp to copy to NFS volumes (avoiding mv ownership issues)
  - Key Code Segments: 
    * Flutter install: git clone to /tmp/flutter-install, sudo cp -r to /opt/flutter
    * Android install: wget cmdline-tools to /tmp/android-install, unzip, sudo cp to /opt/android-sdk
    * Component install: sdkmanager for platform-tools, platforms;android-34, build-tools
    * Flutter config: flutter config --android-sdk, flutter doctor
  - Dependencies: Requires sudo, git, wget, unzip, works around NFS limitations

- flutter.sh:
  - Purpose: Helper script for executing flutter commands in container
  - Current State: Wrapper that calls docker exec -it flutter-dev flutter [args]
  - Dependencies: Requires container named flutter-dev to be running

4. Problem Resolution:
- Issues Encountered:
  * NFS noexec mount: Cannot execute binaries directly from /home/mamaral-/sgoinfre
  * NFS chown restriction: chown commands fail with "Invalid argument" on NFS filesystem
  * NFS mv ownership preservation: mv failed to preserve ownership with "Invalid argument"
  * mv --no-preserve flag: Option not supported in Ubuntu 22.04 coreutils version
  * Git clone directly to NFS: "already exists and is not an empty directory" on volume mount points
  
- Solutions Implemented:
  * Use Docker container: Binaries CAN execute from NFS-mounted volumes inside containers
  * Staging strategy: Download to /tmp (local filesystem), then copy to /opt (NFS)
  * Remove chown commands: NFS doesn't support, developer user has sudo anyway
  * Use cp instead of mv: cp doesn't attempt ownership preservation by default
  * sudo prefix: Required for write access to /opt directories created by root during volume mount

- Debugging Context: Currently iterating on setup-sdks.sh script to complete successful installation. Last issue was mv --no-preserve=ownership not supported, switched to cp -r approach.

- Lessons Learned:
  * NFS has significant limitations (noexec, no chown, ownership preservation issues)
  * Docker volumes created at runtime are owned by root
  * Ubuntu 22.04 mv doesn't support --no-preserve flag
  * Staging downloads in /tmp avoids NFS complications

5. Progress Tracking:
- Completed Tasks:
  ‚úÖ Docker environment structure (Dockerfile, docker-compose.yaml)
  ‚úÖ User permissions setup (developer with NOPASSWD sudo)
  ‚úÖ Volume mapping strategy (NFS for SDKs, local for dev files)
  ‚úÖ Download + copy approach to avoid NFS issues
  ‚úÖ Removed chown commands that failed on NFS
  ‚úÖ Fixed Docker overlay2 corruption issue
  
- Partially Complete Work:
  ‚è≥ setup-sdks.sh script execution - Flutter SDK section updated to use cp, Android section needs same update
  ‚è≥ First container run to install SDKs
  
- Validated Outcomes:
  ‚úÖ Docker container builds successfully
  ‚úÖ Container starts and runs setup-sdks.sh
  ‚úÖ Git clone to /tmp works
  ‚úÖ sudo cp from /tmp to /opt works for Flutter

6. Active Work State:
- Current Focus: Finalizing setup-sdks.sh to use cp -r instead of mv for copying downloaded SDKs from /tmp to NFS-backed /opt directories
  
- Recent Context: 
  * User reported "mv: unrecognized option '--no-preserve=ownership'" error
  * Agent modified Flutter SDK section to use "sudo cp -r flutter-sdk/. $FLUTTER_HOME/" instead of mv
  * About to modify Android cmdline-tools section with same cp approach
  
- Working Code: 
  ```bash
  # Flutter SDK installation (updated)
  TMP_DIR="/tmp/flutter-install"
  git clone https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git flutter-sdk -b stable --depth 1
  sudo rm -rf "$FLUTTER_HOME"/* "$FLUTTER_HOME"/.* 2>/dev/null || true

  ```
  
- Immediate Context: Was executing replace_string_in_file to change Flutter section from mv to cp when token budget exceeded. Android cmdline-tools section still needs same update.

7. Recent Operations:
- Last Agent Commands:
  * replace_string_in_file: Updated setup-sdks.sh Flutter SDK section to use cp -r instead of mv --no-preserve=ownership
  * Previous: run_in_terminal docker-compose down && docker-compose up -d --build
  * Previous: get_terminal_output showing mv: unrecognized option error
  
- Tool Results Summary:
  * Docker build succeeded with updated Dockerfile containing sudo package
  * Container started successfully
  * Docker logs showed: "mv: unrecognized option '--no-preserve=ownership'" from setup-sdks.sh
  * Earlier attempts showed extensive "failed to preserve ownership: Invalid argument" errors for hundreds of files
  * Even earlier: "chown: changing ownership of [files]: Invalid argument" on NFS
  
- Pre-Summary State: Agent had just modified Flutter SDK installation section in setup-sdks.sh to use cp -r command, was about to modify Android cmdline-tools section similarly to complete the fix

- Operation Context: User needs Flutter+Android development environment in Docker with SDKs persisting to NFS storage due to local storage constraint. Core technical challenge is NFS filesystem limitations (noexec, no ownership operations). Solution pattern: download to /tmp, sudo cp to /opt (NFS), avoid any chown/ownership commands.

8. Continuation Plan:
- [Update Android cmdline-tools section]: Change "sudo mv cmdline-tools" to "sudo cp -r cmdline-tools" in setup-sdks.sh line ~40
  
- [Rebuild and test]: Run docker-compose down && docker-compose up -d --build to test complete installation with cp approach

</summary>

<summary>
1. Conversation Overview:
- Primary Objectives: 
  - "contenerizar o VSCode com Flutter (e todas as dependencias para Android) instalado"
  - Use NFS storage (/home/mamaral-/sgoinfre) for SDKs due to <5GB local storage limit
  - Share development files via pastaCompartilhada between host and container
  - No sudo access on host, all installation must happen in container
  
- Session Context: Started with attempting Docker + VSCode in container approach, discovered NFS noexec prevented binary execution. Attempted local installation with symlinks, but hit same noexec issue. Returned to Docker as solution since containers can execute binaries from NFS-mounted volumes. Currently debugging installation script to properly copy Flutter/Android SDKs from /tmp to NFS volumes without triggering ownership errors.

- User Intent Evolution: Initial request was containerized VSCode + Flutter. Evolved to understanding core issue was NFS noexec restriction. Final approach: Docker container with SDKs on NFS (where they CAN execute), VSCode running on host connecting to container.

2. Technical Foundation:
- Docker/docker-compose: Container orchestration for Flutter development environment
- Ubuntu 22.04: Base container image
- OpenJDK 11: Required for Android SDK tools (sdkmanager, platform-tools)
- Flutter SDK (stable): ~1.5GB, installed to /opt/flutter (NFS-backed volume)
- Android SDK: cmdline-tools + platform-tools + build-tools + platforms;android-34, installed to /opt/android-sdk
- NFS constraints: /home/mamaral-/sgoinfre mounted with noexec, no chown support, no ownership preservation

3. Codebase Status:
- Dockerfile:
  - Purpose: Define Flutter development container image
  - Current State: Installs Ubuntu 22.04, dependencies (git, wget, curl, openjdk-11, sudo, build tools), creates developer user with NOPASSWD sudo
  - Key Segments: RUN apt-get install with sudo package; RUN useradd -m developer with sudoers entry; RUN mkdir /opt directories with developer ownership
  - Dependencies: Base for entire containerized environment
  
- docker-compose.yaml:
  - Purpose: Orchestrate container with volume mappings
  - Current State: Maps 5 NFS volumes (/opt/flutter, /opt/android-sdk, /opt/pub-cache, /opt/gradle-cache, /opt/android-config) and 1 local volume (pastaCompartilhada to /home/developer/project)
  - Key Segments: Volume definitions using /home/mamaral-/sgoinfre paths; command points to setup-sdks.sh
  - Dependencies: Requires NFS mount availability, local pastaCompartilhada directory

- setup-sdks.sh:
  - Purpose: Initialize Flutter and Android SDK installations in container on first run
  - Current State: Modified to use /tmp as staging area, cp to copy to NFS volumes (avoiding mv ownership issues)
  - Key Code Segments: 
    * Flutter install: git clone to /tmp/flutter-install, sudo cp -r to /opt/flutter
    * Android install: wget cmdline-tools to /tmp/android-install, unzip, sudo cp to /opt/android-sdk
    * Component install: sdkmanager for platform-tools, platforms;android-34, build-tools
    * Flutter config: flutter config --android-sdk, flutter doctor
  - Dependencies: Requires sudo, git, wget, unzip, works around NFS limitations

- flutter.sh:
  - Purpose: Helper script for executing flutter commands in container
  - Current State: Wrapper that calls docker exec -it flutter-dev flutter [args]
  - Dependencies: Requires container named flutter-dev to be running

4. Problem Resolution:
- Issues Encountered:
  * NFS noexec mount: Cannot execute binaries directly from /home/mamaral-/sgoinfre
  * NFS chown restriction: chown commands fail with "Invalid argument" on NFS filesystem
  * NFS mv ownership preservation: mv failed to preserve ownership with "Invalid argument"
  * mv --no-preserve flag: Option not supported in Ubuntu 22.04 coreutils version
  * Git clone directly to NFS: "already exists and is not an empty directory" on volume mount points
  
- Solutions Implemented:
  * Use Docker container: Binaries CAN execute from NFS-mounted volumes inside containers
  * Staging strategy: Download to /tmp (local filesystem), then copy to /opt (NFS)
  * Remove chown commands: NFS doesn't support, developer user has sudo anyway
  * Use cp instead of mv: cp doesn't attempt ownership preservation by default
  * sudo prefix: Required for write access to /opt directories created by root during volume mount

- Debugging Context: Currently iterating on setup-sdks.sh script to complete successful installation. Last issue was mv --no-preserve=ownership not supported, switched to cp -r approach.

- Lessons Learned:
  * NFS has significant limitations (noexec, no chown, ownership preservation issues)
  * Docker volumes created at runtime are owned by root
  * Ubuntu 22.04 mv doesn't support --no-preserve flag
  * Staging downloads in /tmp avoids NFS complications

5. Progress Tracking:
- Completed Tasks:

fi"}

response.value:
Perfeito! A corre√ß√£o foi aplicada. O problema era que `/opt/flutter` √© um **mount point** (ponto de montagem do volume Docker/NFS), ent√£o n√£o podemos remover o diret√≥rio em si com `rm -rf "$FLUTTER_HOME"`. 

A solu√ß√£o foi usar:
```bash
sudo find "$FLUTTER_HOME" -mindepth 1 -maxdepth 1 -exec rm -rf {} \;
```

#!/bin/bash
set -e

echo "üöÄ Configurando ambiente Flutter/Android..."

# Cores
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m'

# 1. Instalar Flutter SDK
if [ ! -f "$FLUTTER_HOME/bin/flutter" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Baixando Flutter SDK...${NC}"
    TMP_DIR="/tmp/flutter-install"
    rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$TMP_DIR"
    cd "$TMP_DIR"
    git clone https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git flutter-sdk -b stable --depth 1
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Copiando para $FLUTTER_HOME...${NC}"
    # Limpar apenas o conte√∫do do diret√≥rio (n√£o o pr√≥prio diret√≥rio que √© um mount point)
    sudo find "$FLUTTER_HOME" -mindepth 1 -delete 2>/dev/null || true
    
    # Copiar diretamente do tmp para o destino
    sudo cp -r flutter-sdk/. "$FLUTTER_HOME"/
    
    # Adicionar permiss√µes de execu√ß√£o aos bin√°rios Flutter
    sudo chmod -R +x "$FLUTTER_HOME/bin"
    
    cd ~
    rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK instalado${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK j√° existe${NC}"
fi

# 2. Instalar Android cmdline-tools
if [ ! -f "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/bin/sdkmanager" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Baixando Android cmdline-tools...${NC}"
    TMP_DIR="/tmp/android-install"
    rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$TMP_DIR"
    cd "$TMP_DIR"
    wget -q https://dl.google.com/android/repository/commandlinetools-linux-8512546_latest.zip
    unzip -q commandlinetools-linux-8512546_latest.zip
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Copiando para $ANDROID_HOME...${NC}"
    sudo mkdir -p "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools"
    sudo cp -r cmdline-tools "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest"
    
    # Adicionar permiss√µes de execu√ß√£o aos bin√°rios (sem -type f para garantir que funcione no NFS)
    sudo chmod -R +x "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/bin"
    
    cd ~
    rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Android cmdline-tools instalado${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Android cmdline-tools j√° existe${NC}"
fi

# 3. Instalar componentes Android
SDKMANAGER="$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/bin/sdkmanager"
if [ ! -d "$ANDROID_HOME/platform-tools" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Instalando componentes Android...${NC}"
    yes | "$SDKMANAGER" --licenses >/dev/null 2>&1 || true
    "$SDKMANAGER" "platform-tools" "platforms;android-34" "build-tools;34.0.0"
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Componentes Android instalados${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Componentes Android j√° existem${NC}"
fi

# 4. Configurar Flutter
echo -e "${YELLOW}‚öôÔ∏è  Configurando Flutter...${NC}"
export FLUTTER_DISABLE_ANALYTICS=true
flutter config --no-analytics
flutter config --android-sdk "$ANDROID_HOME"
flutter doctor

echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Ambiente pronto!${NC}"
echo ""
echo "üì± Use: flutter <comando>"
echo "üîß Workspace: /workspace"
echo ""

Vamos com a Op√ß√£o 2 - adicionar `sudo` de volta onde necess√°rio:

## Resumo da solu√ß√£o de ownership no NFS:

O problema √© que **os arquivos no NFS pertencem ao UID do host (101034), que n√£o existe no container**.

- O usu√°rio `developer` no container tem `NOPASSWD:ALL` no sudoers
- Com sudo, o container consegue escrever como root, ignorando o mismatch de UID

**Op√ß√£o 2**: Usar `sudo` no script para escrever (j√° temos isso configurado)

Vamos com a Op√ß√£o 2 - adicionar `sudo` de volta onde necess√°rio:

toolCalls.name: read_file

## Resumo da solu√ß√£o de ownership no NFS:

O problema √© que **os arquivos no NFS pertencem ao UID do host (101034), que n√£o existe no container**. 

‚úÖ **Solu√ß√£o implementada:**
- Usar `sudo` para todas as opera√ß√µes de escrita no NFS
- O usu√°rio `developer` no container tem `NOPASSWD:ALL` no sudoers
- Com sudo, o container consegue escrever como root, ignorando o mismatch de UID

Agora a instala√ß√£o deve prosseguir! üéØ

   - Container: `developer` (UID 1000) 
   - NFS preserva UID do host ‚Üí Container n√£o tem permiss√£o de escrita

   - "Invalid argument" sempre que tenta mudar ownership

antes de executar**

√© filesystem local sem `noexec`

# 3. Instalar componentes Android
if [ ! -d "$ANDROID_HOME/platform-tools" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Instalando componentes Android...${NC}"
    
    # Copiar sdkmanager para /tmp com sudo (contornar noexec do NFS)
    sudo cp -r "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest" /tmp/cmdline-tools-temp
    sudo chmod -R +x /tmp/cmdline-tools-temp/bin
    SDKMANAGER="/tmp/cmdline-tools-temp/bin/sdkmanager"
    
    # Criar diret√≥rio de config se n√£o existir
    mkdir -p "$HOME/.android"
    touch "$HOME/.android/repositories.cfg"
    
    # Aceitar licen√ßas e instalar componentes
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Aceitando licen√ßas...${NC}"
    yes | "$SDKMANAGER" --sdk_root="$ANDROID_HOME" --licenses 2>&1 || true
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Instalando platform-tools, build-tools e platform...${NC}"
    "$SDKMANAGER" --sdk_root="$ANDROID_HOME" --verbose "platform-tools" "platforms;android-34" "build-tools;34.0.0"
    
    sudo rm -rf /tmp/cmdline-tools-temp
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Componentes Android instalados${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Componentes Android j√° existem${NC}"
fi

Second, use userns=host to disable isolation, although that may require extra privileges. Lastly, I can configure the daemon‚Äôs remapping to include UID 101034, ensuring the correct entries are present.

**Understanding user namespace mapping**

I‚Äôm realizing that user namespaces map a range starting at 0 in the container to host UIDs. To include UID 101034, I need that range to cover it. When setting --user 101034, Docker tries to translate that into the host‚Äôs subuid, but it must exist in the subuid range. Given that 101034 seems high, it's probably out of the default range, which is typically around 231072 and higher. The error "unmapped uid 101034" indicates no mapping exists for that UID in the user namespace.

**Addressing UID mapping challenges**

To run as UID 101034, the container‚Äôs user namespace must include a range of at least 101035, which seems unlikely. 

One alternative could be creating a user inside the container with the same UID and GID as the host mount ownership, like using 'useradd -u 101034 -g 4222 developer' in the Dockerfile. However, if user namespaces are in use, this won‚Äôt resolve the issues. If userns isn‚Äôt enabled, it could allow access to NFS directories. Given the operating environment, setting the user to 101034 could lead to errors, so I recommend not doing that and using sudo instead.

First, the Docker daemon must run without user namespaces, or I can disable user namespaces for the container by using the command `docker run --userns=host`, or setting `userns_mode: host` in the docker-compose file. edits.text:
#!/bin/bash
set -e

echo "üöÄ Configurando ambiente Flutter/Android..."

# Cores
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m'

# 1. Instalar Flutter SDK
if [ ! -f "$FLUTTER_HOME/bin/flutter" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Baixando Flutter SDK...${NC}"
    TMP_DIR="/home/developer/flutter-install"
    rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$TMP_DIR"
    cd "$TMP_DIR"
    git clone https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git flutter-sdk -b stable --depth 1
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Copiando para $FLUTTER_HOME...${NC}"
    # Usar sudo para escrever no NFS (ownership pertence ao host)
    sudo cp -r flutter-sdk/* "$FLUTTER_HOME"/ 2>/dev/null || true
    sudo cp -r flutter-sdk/.??* "$FLUTTER_HOME"/ 2>/dev/null || true
    
    # Permiss√µes de execu√ß√£o
    sudo chmod -R +x "$FLUTTER_HOME/bin" 2>/dev/null || true
    
    cd ~
    rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK instalado${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK j√° existe${NC}"
fi

# 2. Instalar Android cmdline-tools
if [ ! -f "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/bin/sdkmanager" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Baixando Android cmdline-tools...${NC}"
    TMP_DIR="/tmp/android-install"
    rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$TMP_DIR"
    cd "$TMP_DIR"
    wget -q https://dl.google.com/android/repository/commandlinetools-linux-8512546_latest.zip
    unzip -q commandlinetools-linux-8512546_latest.zip
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Copiando para $ANDROID_HOME...${NC}"
    # Criar subdiret√≥rio correto e copiar CONTE√öDO (sem aninhar cmdline-tools/cmdline-tools)
    sudo mkdir -p "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest" 2>/dev/null || true
    # Conte√∫do vis√≠vel
    sudo cp -r cmdline-tools/* "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/"
    # Arquivos ocultos, se houver
    sudo cp -r cmdline-tools/.??* "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/" 2>/dev/null || true
    
    # Permiss√µes de execu√ß√£o
    sudo chmod -R +x "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/bin" 2>/dev/null || true
    
    cd ~
    rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Android cmdline-tools instalado${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Android cmdline-tools j√° existe${NC}"
fi

# 3. Instalar componentes Android
if [ ! -d "$ANDROID_HOME/platform-tools" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Instalando componentes Android...${NC}"
    
    # Copiar sdkmanager para /tmp com sudo (contornar noexec do NFS)
    sudo cp -r "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest" /tmp/cmdline-tools-temp
    sudo chmod -R +x /tmp/cmdline-tools-temp/bin
    SDKMANAGER="/tmp/cmdline-tools-temp/bin/sdkmanager"
    
    # Criar diret√≥rio de config se n√£o existir
    mkdir -p "$HOME/.android"
    touch "$HOME/.android/repositories.cfg"
    
    # Aceitar licen√ßas e instalar componentes
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Aceitando licen√ßas...${NC}"
    yes | "$SDKMANAGER" --sdk_root="$ANDROID_HOME" --licenses 2>&1 || true
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Instalando platform-tools, build-tools e platform...${NC}"
    "$SDKMANAGER" --sdk_root="$ANDROID_HOME" --verbose "platform-tools" "platforms;android-34" "build-tools;34.0.0"
    
    sudo rm -rf /tmp/cmdline-tools-temp
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Componentes Android instalados${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Componentes Android j√° existem${NC}"
fi

# 4. Configurar Flutter
echo -e "${YELLOW}‚öôÔ∏è  Configurando Flutter...${NC}"
export FLUTTER_DISABLE_ANALYTICS=true
flutter config --no-analytics
flutter config --android-sdk "$ANDROID_HOME"
flutter doctor

echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Ambiente pronto!${NC}"
echo ""
echo "üì± Use: flutter <comando>"
echo "üîß Workspace: /workspace"
echo ""

#!/bin/bash
set -e

echo "üöÄ Configurando ambiente Flutter/Android..."

# Cores
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m'

# 1. Instalar Flutter SDK
if [ ! -f "$FLUTTER_HOME/bin/flutter" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Baixando Flutter SDK...${NC}"
    TMP_DIR="/home/developer/flutter-install"
    rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$TMP_DIR"
    cd "$TMP_DIR"
    git clone https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git flutter-sdk -b stable --depth 1
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Copiando para $FLUTTER_HOME...${NC}"
    # Usar sudo para escrever no NFS (ownership pertence ao host)
    sudo cp -r flutter-sdk/* "$FLUTTER_HOME"/ 2>/dev/null || true
    sudo cp -r flutter-sdk/.??* "$FLUTTER_HOME"/ 2>/dev/null || true
    
    # Permiss√µes de execu√ß√£o
    sudo chmod -R +x "$FLUTTER_HOME/bin" 2>/dev/null || true
    
    cd ~
    rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK instalado${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Flutter SDK j√° existe${NC}"
fi

# 2. Instalar Android cmdline-tools
if [ ! -f "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/bin/sdkmanager" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Baixando Android cmdline-tools...${NC}"
    TMP_DIR="/tmp/android-install"
    rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$TMP_DIR"
    cd "$TMP_DIR"
    wget -q https://dl.google.com/android/repository/commandlinetools-linux-8512546_latest.zip
    unzip -q commandlinetools-linux-8512546_latest.zip
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Copiando para $ANDROID_HOME...${NC}"
    # Criar subdiret√≥rio correto e copiar CONTE√öDO (sem aninhar cmdline-tools/cmdline-tools)
    sudo mkdir -p "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest" 2>/dev/null || true
    # Conte√∫do vis√≠vel
    sudo cp -r cmdline-tools/* "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/"
    # Arquivos ocultos, se houver
    sudo cp -r cmdline-tools/.??* "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/" 2>/dev/null || true
    
    # Permiss√µes de execu√ß√£o
    sudo chmod -R +x "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/bin" 2>/dev/null || true
    
    cd ~
    rm -rf "$TMP_DIR"
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Android cmdline-tools instalado${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Android cmdline-tools j√° existe${NC}"
fi

# 3. Instalar componentes Android
if [ ! -d "$ANDROID_HOME/platform-tools" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Instalando componentes Android...${NC}"
    
    # Copiar sdkmanager para /tmp com sudo (contornar noexec do NFS)
    sudo rm -rf /tmp/cmdline-tools-temp
    sudo mkdir -p /tmp/cmdline-tools-temp
    sudo cp -r "$ANDROID_HOME/cmdline-tools/latest/." /tmp/cmdline-tools-temp/
    sudo chmod -R +x /tmp/cmdline-tools-temp/bin
    SDKMANAGER="/tmp/cmdline-tools-temp/bin/sdkmanager"
    
    # Criar diret√≥rio de config se n√£o existir (NFS pode exigir sudo)
    sudo mkdir -p "$HOME/.android"
    sudo touch "$HOME/.android/repositories.cfg"
    
    # Aceitar licen√ßas e instalar componentes
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Aceitando licen√ßas...${NC}"
    yes | "$SDKMANAGER" --sdk_root="$ANDROID_HOME" --licenses 2>&1 || true
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Instalando platform-tools, build-tools e platform...${NC}"
    "$SDKMANAGER" --sdk_root="$ANDROID_HOME" --verbose "platform-tools" "platforms;android-34" "build-tools;34.0.0"
    
    sudo rm -rf /tmp/cmdline-tools-temp
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Componentes Android instalados${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úì Componentes Android j√° existem${NC}"
fi

# 4. Configurar Flutter
echo -e "${YELLOW}‚öôÔ∏è  Configurando Flutter...${NC}"
export FLUTTER_DISABLE_ANALYTICS=true
flutter config --no-analytics
flutter config --android-sdk "$ANDROID_HOME"
flutter doctor

echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Ambiente pronto!${NC}"
echo ""
echo "üì± Use: flutter <comando>"
echo "üîß Workspace: /workspace"
echo ""
